titles: The poore man payes for all This is but a dreame which here shall insue: but the author wishes his words were not true. To the tune of In slumbring sleepe I lay.
notes: Printer's name and suggested publication date from STC.
Verse - "As I lay musing all alone,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
